catalog_info.title: Political Theory of Civil-Military Relations
catalog_info.description: Who shall guard the guardians?  This course examines a series of answers to this question within the history of political thought and contemporary political science.  We will explore the difference between soldiers and civilians, consider how variations in political regime and economic development shape relations between military and society, and examine recent “crises” in U.S. civil-military relations.  Readings include Plato, Plutarch, Shakespeare, Machiavelli, Harrington, Huntington, and Feaver.
